name: Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre

reviews.text: Spent 2 weeks here in June, on a business trip. This is not a brand new construction, but a renovated property. Rooms are fine, but the A/C was a little weak, even in a non peak month. And by the 10th day, the room was gerrting really stuffy.
reviews.title: Below average for a 5*Star

reviews.text: I had booked directly through Marriott property at $X per night. The front desk tried to pull a fast one by charging me in Indian Rupees at an exorbitant premium. The going rate for INR to USD is around 40 to 1. They charged me at 46 to 1. By the time the credit card company converted it back to USD at 40, I was paying a 15% premium on $X. So, watch out! Anyway, it look a scathing letter to the marriott customer service to get this corrected. When every thing is said and done, no harm done.
reviews.title: Very mediocre for an Indian 5-star

reviews.text: I agree with the assessment in one of thre previous reviews. I am of India origin who has spend half my life in India. Even I found it hard to understand their English. I am not talking about the room service boys. Even the front desk had a problem conversing in fluent English. Hardly expected in a 5 star property.
reviews.title: Lot's of Australians in India

reviews.text: Food was excellent. No complaints there. Buffets are all well stacked and reasonably priced at around $16-$17.
reviews.title: One of the best in Hyderabad

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott in Hyderabad for 3 weeks in November 2006.
reviews.title: Friendly Service, but not yet Polished

reviews.text: To summarise the hotel, we think they try really hard, but still haven't got the polished service of a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Improving and a good future prospect

reviews.text: The service is very friendly and they aim to please, but the service lacks a polished finish. Sometimes there was confusion over requests and assumptions made by staff that caused minor problems, although they did have the best intentions.
reviews.title: A very good hotel
Fantastic Hotel: great rooms, friendly staff
reviews.text: Security into the hotel is good. They check every car and there is a metal detector to enter the hotel and bags are checked.

The hotel is well decorated and the lifts are glass and face into the open lobby area. There are 2 restaurants and a bar in the hotel. Okra is the main restaurant which is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Okra has a good variety of both Indian and western food. For any Aussies, they also have supplies of Vegemite!! Bidri is a more up market restaurant that is only open for dinner and serves Indian food. The hotel bar is magnificent in both ambience and service.

description: Overlooking the Hussain Sagar Lake, Hyderabad Marriott Hotel & Convention Centre blends fresh style and traditional aesthetics to provide premium accommodation for the business and leisure traveler. Situated in the heart of the city, Hyderabad Marriott is conveniently located just 35 mins from the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport and has an easy access to the business districts US Consulate, HICC, Hitech City; along with the historic monuments like SalarJung Museum, Charminar, Golkonda & Laad Bazaar. An ideal destination for conventions, the hotel houses a Convention Centre with the latest AV and interpretation facilities. The hotel’s picturesque location with 13,000 sq ft of outdoor spaces and sumptuous restaurants make it a popular Convention destination.
